alert.note: Alert for Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT, NORTHEASTERN DE BACA, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND WESTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 441 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Taiban, or 8 miles east of Fort Sumner, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner, Melrose, House, Tolar and Taiban. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 331 and 361. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
